script.speaker: true
script.text: Greetings, how can I help you?

script.speaker: false
script.text: Nothing today, thanks

script.speaker: true
script.text: Oh you're awake!

script.speaker: false
script.text: Where am I?

script.speaker: true
script.text: You're in the town of [], you washed up on the beach last night unconcious. We were able to ressusitate you, but you passed out not long after

script.speaker: false
script.text: Everything feels so foggy, I can't remember anything

script.speaker: true
script.text: Amnesia? Strange, but not unheard of with something like this. Do you remember your name?

script.speaker: false
script.text: My name... {Player_Name} I think?

script.speaker: true
script.text: We did find this longsword on you, perhaps you're a warrior of some sort?

script.speaker: false
script.text: That does ring a bell, yes I think so. Can I hold it?

script.speaker: false
script.text: Yes this feels familiar, my sword...

script.speaker: true
script.text: That's progress. We've checked you out, and you seem well enough, perhaps swinging that thing around will help jog your memory

script.speaker: false
script.text: That seems a little dangerous in a hospital

script.speaker: true
script.text: Oh goodness no not here! There is an old adventurer who lives in a red house in the north west of the village, he has a small training area to keep up his skills.

script.speaker: true
script.text: That or you could try your hand against some of the goblins north of town

script.speaker: false
script.text: I think I'll go talk to that adventurer, thanks

script.speaker: true
script.text: Best of luck! Remember, if you need to rest up, you can always come back here and sleep in this bed

script.speaker: false
script.text: You want an amnesiac to go fight for you?

script.speaker: true
script.text: Well, normally I would loathe to suggest it, but they did recently steal an important relic from us...

script.speaker: true
script.text: There's one who's been spying on us alone just north of town, he shouldn't be too much trouble. Maybe try your hand against him, and if that feels okay, they've holed up in a temple to the east

links.label: Maybe I'll look into the goblins

script.speaker: false
script.text: Hmm maybe I'll try my hand against the lone goblin

script.speaker: true
script.text: Best of luck! Remember, if you need to rest up, you can always come back here and sleep in this bed

script.speaker: true
script.text: Greetings, how can I help you?

script.speaker: false
script.text: Nothing today, thanks

links.label: I'd like a room for the night

script.speaker: true
script.text: What do you want?

script.speaker: false
script.text: I washed up on the beach last night, the local priests took me in and patched me up

script.speaker: true
script.text: What does that have to do with me?

script.speaker: false
script.text: When I woke up I couldn't remember anything. They found a longsword on me, thought I might be a fighter. Thought maybe talking to another fighter could job my memory

script.speaker: true
script.text: Damn priests, think any dandy with a sword is a fighter. Well if you are a fighter, show me your stance

links.label: Take up one handed fighting stance

script.speaker: true
script.text: Hmm your forms not bad, perhaps you have had some training. A one handed stance will make your swings quicker, but will make them a little less powerful.

script.speaker: true
script.text: Speed helps you land blows on your opponent, and dodge your foes attacks, but power makes your blows harder to block and deal more damage.

links.label: Take up two handed fighting stance

script.speaker: true
script.text: Hmm your forms not bad, perhaps you have had some training. A two handed stance will grant your swings more power, but will make them a little slower

script.speaker: true
script.text: Power makes your blows more difficult to block, and increases the damage they do, but speed makes it easier to land blows in the first place, and easier to avoid your foes blows.

script.speaker: true
script.text: Any of this ringing a bell?

links.label: Sort of, can you tell me more?

script.speaker: true
script.text: Sure. Now you may be wondering what the difference is between a blow being dodged or blocked. Either way I'm not killing my opponent, right?

script.speaker: true
script.text: Wrong! If a blow is dodged, it will have no impact on an opponent, but if a blow is blocked, it will still wear the opponent down, wittling down their stamina.

script.speaker: true
script.text: The more powerful the blow, the more it will wear them down.

script.speaker: true
script.text: If you can wittle away an enemies stamina down to nothing, they will become staggered, making them much easier to actually hit, or to land a vital hit on.

script.speaker: true
script.text: A solid hit will lower an opponents stamina by quite a bit, and has a chance of dealing vital damage.

script.speaker: true
script.text: A vital hit is one that's guaranteed to do vital damage, that's what's actually going to take down your foe.

script.speaker: true
script.text: Sorry for rambling, is this helpful? Would you like to know more?

links.label: Yeah this is helpful, tell me more

script.speaker: true
script.text: Now if you want to avoid getting hit, you'll want to focus on improving your speed

script.speaker: true
script.text: If you want to be better at blocking hits, you'll want to increase your guard. Speed, helps with this, but your weapon can also help of hinder your guard

script.speaker: true
script.text: If you want to avoid vital hits, you'll need good armor that protects you against them. If you're well armored, your chances of being vitally hit are very slim.

script.speaker: true
script.text: Unless of course, you're up against an opponent with an armor piercing weapon, those can score vital hits even on well armored foes, but are usually slower.

script.speaker: true
script.text: And of course if you find yourself up against an armored foe, you'll want to reach for an armor piercing weapon like a hammer, or else you'll have to wear your opponents stamina all the way down.

script.speaker: true
script.text: Well while I'm rambling, want me to tell you about the flow of battle?

links.label: Yeah tell me all about it

script.speaker: true
script.text: Well, in combat every action you take, from moving, to attacking, to switching your fighting stance will cost initiative points

script.speaker: true
script.text: When it's your turn, you will only have so much initiative to use, and once it's used up, you'll have to give someone else a turn

script.speaker: true
script.text: The initial order of turns will be random, but over time it will reorder itself. This is known as upkeep. If you can use less initiative on your turn than your opponents, you will move up in the order

script.speaker: true
script.text: If you spend your initiative wisely, and time things right around upkeep, you could could the chance to take two turns in a row, turning the tide of battle

script.speaker: true
script.text: Well, that's about all I can teach you for right now. Best to go out and practice what you've learned before I teach you anything else.

script.speaker: false
script.text: Thanks for the help, all this sounds familiar, I'm sure once I'm in the thick of it, it will all come back.

script.speaker: true
script.text: Alright well best of luck, don't go getting yourself killed out there.

links.label: Yeah it's all coming back, thanks for the help (leave)

script.speaker: true
script.text: Glad I could help, don't get yourself killed out there.
